problem: John decides to run 5 sprints 6 times a week.  He runs 30 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
John decides to run 3 sprints 4 times a week.  He runs 65 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
Josh decides to run 5 sprints 8 times a week.  He runs 41 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
Hose decides to run 2 sprints 3 times a week.  He runs 70 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
solution:
He sprints 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 times
So he runs 6*70=<<6*70=420>>420 meters
#### 420

problem: Lara, Lucia, Natasha, Samantha wants to buy a $799.00 pair of shoes and a matching belt that is $56.00.  Her part-time job pays her $21.00 an hour.  How many hours will she have to work before she can make her purchase?
solution:
She wants to buy a pair of shoes for $799.00 and a belt for $56.00 for a total of 799+56 = $<<799+56=855.00>>855.00
Her purchase will total $855.00 and she makes $21.00 at her part-time job so she'll have to work 855/21 = <<855/21=40>>40 hours

problem: A waterpolo team has 115 members.  There are twice as many players on the offense as there is on the defense. There is half the number of players on the special teams as there is on the defense.  How many players are on the defense?
solution:
Let x represent the number of players on the defense
Offense:2x
Special Teams:(1/2)x
Total:x+2x+(1/2)x=115
(7/2)x=115
x=115(2/7)=32 players
#### 32

problem: James injured his back and needs to go to physical therapy.  He went to physical therapy for 31 weeks.  Each week he went twice for 6 hours at a time.  If the sessions cost $968 per hour how much did the physical therapy cost?
solution:
Each week he did 2*6=<<2*6=12>>12 hours of physical therapy
So it cost 12*968=$<<12*968=11616>>11616 per week

problem: Jamie, Jethro, Joseph, Jesus saw 10 birds in their backyard and threw a stone at them, scaring away 1/3 of that number. A few minutes later, 50 more birds joined the fearless birds. How many birds are now in the backyard?
solution:
The total number of birds scared away after he threw the stone at them is 1/3 * 10 = <<1/3*10=3>>3 birds.
The total number of birds remaining is 10 - 3 = <<10-3=6>>6 birds.
If 50 more birds joined, the total number of birds in the backyard will become 6 + 50 = <<6+50=56>>56 birds.
#### 56

problem: My sister went to a gardening shop. She bought a set of pots for $57 and a sack of garden soil for $62. At checkout, she used a coupon for $69 off. How much money did my sister spend at the gardening shop?

problem: From her science class study, Susan learned that each whale in the sea has 76 gallons of blood. She also learned that a shark has three times as much blood as a whale. Calculate the number of gallons of blood that ten sharks swimming in the sea have.
solution:
Since a shark has three times as much blood as a whale, then a shark has 3*76 = <<3*76=228>>228 gallons of blood.
10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*228 = <<10*228=2280>>2280 gallons of blood.
#### 2280

problem: From her science class study, Maja learned that each whale in the sea has 40 gallons of blood. She also learned that a shark has three times as much blood as a whale. Calculate the number of gallons of blood that ten sharks swimming in the sea have.
solution:
Since a shark has three times as much blood as a whale, then a shark has 3*40 = <<3*40=120>>120 gallons of blood.
10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*120 = <<10*120=1200>>1200 gallons of blood.
#### 1200
